Articles.Content:
Hoe do you install EVE using Ckan, i cant find it in the list of mods

TIA
how do i get rid of the citys?

Is it normal for gpu to hit 99% usage on KSC and R&D window?

I have gtx1060 6gb which doesn't go beyond 80% usage while playing. But the only time it goes 99% and over 80'c is when im KSC and R&D building.

Look at top left corner for gpu usage and temp.

Here's the Player.log and mod list.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/cctd5dlak7m86lb/Player.log?dl=0

Spoiler

I just wanna thank the creators of this mod for making this visual masterpiece!

Currently using a 4k texture for AVP
Some Duna stuff I have going
Is OPM compatible with the latest AVP Version???

how do i get rid of the citys?

and is there dust on minimus?

Edited July 3, 2020 by Not a Spy

On 7/2/2020 at 2:00 PM, Dogmeat551 said:

Is OPM compatible with the latest AVP Version???

Yup. But be aware of any potential bugs caused by Kopernicus because it is not quite stable on 1.9.1 yet

5 hours ago, Not a Spy said:

how do i get rid of the citys?

and is there dust on minimus?

You can try deleting Kerbal Space Program\GameData\AstronomersVisualPack\AVP_Configs\Stock\CityLights.cfg

Yes there is dust on Minmus

8 hours ago, ra4nd0m said:

Yes there is dust on Minmus

yes

DUST! 

BEAUTIFUL DUST!

I love playing with AVP. I don't think i can play without AVP anymore. Thank you for creating this beautiful mod.

However, there's some things i would like to be changed.

I'm using Sunflares of Maar as suggested by AVP. As you can see in the picture above, the sunflare doesn't appear until the sun is fully visible.

Same applies to the kerbin's atmosphere. (Sorry i don't have a picture on this) Sunflare doesn't appear until the sun is fully out of the atmosphere of kerbin when looked from the space. (I don't know if i'm explaining this clearly enough, ill post some more pictures on this maybe after sometime)

So is there any way to make the sunflare visible even if the sun isn't fully visible? (Make the sunflare gradually appear like the stock sun?)

 

 

[Without TUFX]

[With TUFX] (vessel becomes very dark, when its behind kerbin i can't see anything other than citylights)

Also, the TUFX's AVP config makes the dark side way too dark. I tried changing my ambient light settings but it doesn't change much since TUFX is applying the profile over the stock graphic.

They look perfect in screenshot. But i don't think they are really suitable for actual gameplay. Any tips for adjusting the TUFX config to make them bright while maintaining the same look?

Edited July 5, 2020 by One eyed Smile
TUFX
@One eyed Smile the sun flares will need to be transitioned to a unity flare, which is something that @JadeOfMaar has been wanting to do for a long time.

Ideas for how to fix this? Everything else looks amazing, but this happens whenever I get close to the Mun regardless of what version I'm using.

Also sorry for the image size..
@MassoudGL Did u try quicksave and quickloading it?
When I install Kopernicus , AVP Will no longer have clouds, anyone help?

On 7/10/2020 at 5:52 AM, One eyed Smile said:

@MassoudGL Did u try quicksave and quickloading it?

I did to no avail...but then realized my graphics were turned quite far down. It's gone now, but Idk if that's a graphics issue.
The stock skybox does not show up for on 1.8. I have texture replace installed
Weird glitch on main menu. Got me really scared this time. Never seen this before... haha
Having an issue with the graphics on planet Kerbal. It loads up perfect for a half second then changes to this white Kerbal.
You do know that most of the "optional" downloads are only compatible with other versions of the game

4 hours ago, star_krafter said:

You do know that most of the "optional" downloads are only compatible with other versions of the game

Every single optional mod has been tried and tested to fully work on the latest version (1.10) of Kerbal Space Program, regardless of what versions their latest updates are for.

On 7/13/2020 at 11:21 PM, HaDeZs said:

Having an issue with the graphics on planet Kerbal. It loads up perfect for a half second then changes to this white Kerbal.

I'm getting the same issue as this one actually.  Just installing the mod for the first time, through CKAN.

On 6/21/2020 at 7:17 PM, skzbr said:

Sirs, 

 

Someone knows why my skies are becoming RED at night? Looks like its the clouds

 

https://prnt.sc/t3v4pu

On 6/22/2020 at 6:41 PM, BezKartuza said:

This is normal.

 

I'm getting the same thing. Clouds at the KSC are red at midnight. In the early morning and late evening, yes. At midnight - that's not right. I tried plain EVE configs and the problem is resolved.

They also appear red during the daytime on the main menu but that's fixed once in-game. I don't know if that has anything to do with it.

KSC Red Clouds

Main Menu Red Clouds
Astronomer's Visual Pack has been updated to v4.05, with a version bump for KSP 1.10, changes to Neidon and its terminator, and new loading screens.

20 hours ago, Smerky said:

 

I'm getting the same thing. Clouds at the KSC are red at midnight. In the early morning and late evening, yes. At midnight - that's not right. I tried plain EVE configs and the problem is resolved.

They also appear red during the daytime on the main menu but that's fixed once in-game. I don't know if that has anything to do with it.

KSC Red Clouds

Main Menu Red Clouds

Can you send the config here? ty

On 7/20/2020 at 12:06 AM, skzbr said:

Can you send the config here? ty

It's just the current version of AVP with 4k textures.

If you mean the plain EVE configs they're easily accessible through this website or the mod manager but you have to uninstall AVP.
